item.description: @BaJaeJae @MichelleOnKP @bemusedmuse @DrEricDing They detect fragments of the virus, non-viable virus, and all sorts of bits and pieces that are left AFTER an infection has been cleared. Using a home kit test to decide if you are "well" is not how you do it. They return positive results for months as your body cleans itself up.
@peternlewis I wish there was an "I'm not an idiot or a grandma -- let me use my Mac" mode. But apparently we're all too stupid to know better now. But Nanny @Apple does!
@MichelleOnKP @bemusedmuse @DrEricDing This is silly BS. It's not how they work at all. Stop spreading misinformation. These tests don't detect the virus. They test for antigens.

@DrEricDing The home tests can show positive results for a MONTH or more after infection. They're not for telling when you are well. They are for identifying that you have been infected. You need a PCR test to determine when you are no longer infected, not a home test kit.
